column1: on the channel just outside off stump first up, shoulders his arms after covering the off-stump line with his big stride forward. Nice carry through to the captain
full on off stump but angling across the right-hander's body once more. Guptill happy to shoulder his arms once again
good length on middle stump, defended off the back foot towards the off side. Opens the bat's face as he taps this down with soft hands
good length on middle stump, blocked off the back foot once again. Munro wants the single, but Guptill says 'no'
full on the off-stump line once again, Guptill lets it go
good length on off stump and going through to Sarfraz. Guptill chooses to shoulder his arms once more to see the first over out. Maiden over

full on off stump and Munro tries to muscle this towards mid on, takes a leading edge, but falls just short of wide mid off. First runs, but not convincing at all. Tried to push at it, and the bat turned in his hand. Lucky to survive
full outside off stump and carries through comfortably to Sarfraz. Guptill lets it go once again
full on middle stump, driven along the ground to mid on. Slight shape, back into the right hander, forcing the batsman to adjust late with his footwork
threads the gap! Full on off stump and it's driven extravagantly past cover. Just beats the man at mid off as well, as both infielders give it a chase. Stopped just inside the boundary
overpitched full outside off and late inswing into the left hander, Munro misses the drive as the ball zips under his bat. Excellent ball. Just misses off stump
full outside off and it's punched late off the back foot. Beats the diving cover-fielder
ooo, nice bounce off the deck! Short on middle and flies over Guptill's head. The umpire thinks it's a legal delivery
waist-high full toss outside off stump this time, slipped out of Amir's hand on this occasion. Guptill can't put it away, as he hits it back to Amir. Surprised the batsman
good length on middle stump, stays deep in his crease and nudges this off his hips towards the leg side for a quick single
full on off stump, tucked off his hips past midwicket with ease, calls early for the second run
back of a length outside off and it's punched off the back foot with authority! Just enough room for the batsman to carve this between cover and point. The fielders lose the chase
good length on off stump, tries to tuck this towards the leg side but it comes off the bat's inside edge. Trickles past the square-leg umpire
good length on off stump and zipping straight through. Guptill stays careful in covering his off-stump before shouldering his arms
full outside off and it's smacked over the bowler's head! Flat six! Crashes into the sightscreen. Walked down the wicket and played it with the straight bat
drops his length this time. Good length on middle and leg, defended off the back foot
just misses off stump! Full on off stump and Guptill prods forward before getting his arms out of the way. Not too far from top of off stump
back of a length on middle stump, jams this into the ground as the ball dribbles away past second slip
full and wide outside off, Munro slaps this away from his body, but straight to Malik at mid off. Misses out on a loose ball
good length on middle stump, defended off the back foot with the bat's open face, tapped towards point
goes short this time, pitches on middle stump and Guptill ducks under this rising delivery
good length on middle and off, zips straight through to Sarfraz. Guptill happy to let it go
full on middle stump, defended off the front foot but takes the outside edge. Flies away towards point
yorker just outside off stump, dug back to the bowler. Can't get under this delivery
good length on leg stump, goes deep into his crease and defends off the back foot. Tight over
back of a length on off stump, pulled furiously to deep midwicket. Way too good a shot to fetch only a single
good length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
full on leg stump, tapped off his pads to square leg for a quick run
good length on middle stump, slightly slower ball, nudged off the back foot behind square, they walk through for the single
good length on middle stump, punched off the back foot to mid off. Too close to his body to generate any power
good length on off stump, angling into the left-hander's body. Misses the flick as the ball hits his thigh guard
good length on leg stump and that's swatted away over square leg. Drifting onto Munro's leg side and that's sent away down to the fine-leg boundary
full just outside off, blocked off the back foot. Firmly played back to Amir
back of a length outside off, stays deep in his crease as he punches this off the back foot. Straight to cover

short outside off, pushed off the back foot with the square bat. Hit straight to point, but they're quick to call for the single. Misfield from point, allowing them to complete an easy single. Pressure on the fielders worked
full on off stump, tapped towards point for a quick run
full on off stump, attempted straight drive that takes the outside edge, flies down to third man
full toss on off stump, punched back past Guptill, it's not timed well enough, and it's stopped by mid off's diving effort
short outside off, tries to pull this towards cow corner but Munro bottom edges it into the pitch

good length on leg stump but drifting down the leg side, Guptill tries to flick this off his hips but misses. Brushes his leg as it goes through to the keeper. The umpire calls it a wide, and Sarfraz isn't pleased
short outside leg stump and flies over Guptill's head. Too high, too wide
good length on leg stump, drops the pace a bit, thus making the ball stay low. Guptill can't flick this off his pads, as it hits him near his guts
full on leg stump, clipped off his pads to deep midwicket
short outside off but it's the off cutter, Munro waits for the ball to come to him, before dragging his pull along the ground to deep backward square
full outside off stump, taps it into the gap in front of midwicket. Nobody there, and they easily complete the second
back of a length on off stump, punched off the back foot to mid on
full on off stump and that's smacked in the between midwicket and mid on. Good use of the bottom hand to generate the extra power, as he flicks this in front of square
back of a length outside off, punched off the front foot, but straight to cover
good length outside off, walks across to the off side and firmly punches this down the ground. Mid off intercepts
full on middle stump and it's flicked with ease off his pads. Flies past square leg as the fielder has to give it another chase. Not enough power behind that shot, as the fielder retrieves
good length on middle stump, fended off the front foot. Prodded forward but chose to defend in the end
short on leg stump, tries to hook this over the infield but misses. Hits his body, as it lobs over to short fine leg
good length wide outside off and that's pulled over mid on! What a ridiculous shot, as it lands just inside the long-on boundary. There's the fifty partnership
full outside off and Munro follows the ball. Slashes at it wildly and it takes a thick edge off the bat. Flies over short third man and into the boundary
slogged! Full outside off and that's lifted over midwicket. Slight bend of the knee to get under the ball and the quick bat speed does the rest. Falls just over the boundary ropes.
good length on off stump, slower ball to end the over. Mistimed towards the leg side
full outside off, tapped off the front foot towards the off side
full outside off, driven firmly back past the bowler to mid off. Guptill calls early for the single
back of a length on middle and leg, punched off the back foot to mid off
full on middle stump and it's flicked off his toes to deep midwicket. Slightly in the air, but no one in the infield square on the leg side
back of a length outside off, tapped late off the back foot into the pitch. Trickles down to first slip

edged, but just past first slip! Full outside off and Guptill prods forward to defend, plays down the wrong line as Hasan induces the outside edge, but falls just short of the man at slip, and then goes past him for four
low full toss on leg stump, driven down the ground to long on
tossed up full outside off, squeezes this square towards point. Too full for the batsman to get under it
full on off stump and spins into the left hander, driven down the ground to long on once more
back of a length outside off, Guptill backs away trying to cut late, but mistimes his shot. Straight back to Shadab
tossed up full on middle stump, Guptill steps forward before punching this back past Munro for a single
tossed up once again, another low full toss outside off, firmly hit to long off

good length on middle and leg and it's hooked with ease over fine leg! The fielder looked like he may take the catch, but the breeze takes it over the ropes. A mere top edge, but played with such quick hands, that it clears the ropes
full on middle and leg, tries to flick towards the leg side but takes the inside edge past leg stump. Lucky break, but earns him four more

good length outside off and Munro goes poking at it. Tried to force this through the off side, but it's too close to his body, takes the outside edge and safely taken by the keeper. Hasan Ali is pumped!
full outside off, KW walks across to the off side and tries to punch it square, but the ball stays low. Through to Sarfraz
good length outside off, punched off the back foot as it takes the thick outside edge. Flies through the gap between gully and second slip
back of a length outside off and Guptill's beaten for pace! Goes under his bat while he tries to play a cross-batted shot
back of a length outside off, tapped back to the bowler off the back foot
short and wide outside off, and Williamson slashes hard at it. Looking for the cut shot, as it takes the top edge over the vacant first-slip region
back of a length outside off, bunted back to the bowler off the back foot. No real timing
good length just outside off, stays on the back foot as he taps this towards point
good length outside off, Guptill shoulders his arms
beautiful! Full on middle stump and it's lifted over mid on. Not off the bat's middle, but enough behind it to clear the infield
back of a length outside off, KW shuffles across to the off side and defends off the back foot
full outside off but angling into the right hander, driven down the ground back past the bowler, cut off by mid on
full outside off, defended off the front foot. Firmly tapped back

full outside off and that's driven off the front foot. Chase for cover, but the fielder does very well to retrieve the ball. Nice diving effort from Faheem, but his knee got stuck in the ground. Hopefully he's okay
back of a length outside off, extra bounce off the pitch, defended off the back foot
full on off stump, firmly driven down the ground to mid off. Time for drinks.
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot past cover, comfortable two on offer
back of a length outside off, chops it down to first slip
full on off stump, nips back late into the right hander. Tried to defend but inside edges it into his body
Full outside off and KW shoulders his arms. Slight shuffle towards the off side to cover his stumps
back of a length outside off, tapped back to the bowler with soft hands
back of a length outside off, stays tall and carves this off the back foot past point
back of a length outside off, firmly driven off the back foot to cover
back of a length outside off, tries to work this off the hips towards the leg side, but can't send it away. Trickles away to mid on
full outside off but enough width to cut this. Beats the man at point and there's the team hundred!
back of a length outside off, Guptill sees it through to the keeper. Goes past his eye level
short ball outside off but angling into the right hander, extra bounce off the pitch, Guptill taps it into the ground with soft hands
back of a length on middle stump, tries to work this off the back foot towards the leg side, but can't make contact. Hits his thigh
back of a length in the channel outside off, Williamson loosely hangs the bat out and gets beaten
similar delivery, extra zip and bounce outside off, gets big on Williamson and jags away off the seam to leave him beaten for the second consecutive time
short of good length outside off, gets behind the line nicely and punches to point
back of a length outside off, punches to the left of mid-off for a quick single
short, a little wide, slaps it hard from the crease but point flings himself to his right and makes a brilliant save. Earns the applause of his team-mates
short ball, tries to force a pull but is tucked up for room and gets an inside edge to the thigh guard
short of a length, shifts back and drops it in front of point
minimal turn outside off again, punched into the mid-off region for one
gets no room on the cut and chops it in the direction of third man
full on middle, defended on the front foot
pushed down the ground for a single
full outside off, defended into the off side
short of a length around off, punched off the backfoot to point
length ball, angles in from outside off, bunts it out into point
shortish and a little wide, not short enough, Williamson flashes a cut to point

oh, shot! That is pristine placement. Shot of the day so far? Advances down the track despite the shortness of this delivery but makes sure to give himself enough room to be able to open up his arms and carve this away through the covers. Picks the gap with laser-guided precision
back of a length, gets slightly squared up as the ball finds the outside of his bat on its way to point
short, wide, flashes a cut to the right of sweeper cover for a brace
advances down the ground and carves this one away to mid-on
fullish around off, leans forward and pushes it out into the off side
pitched up on off, eased out to long-off
fullish on middle, defended off the front foot
full on middle and off, another drive down to long-off

Guptill doesn't pick this natural variation and shapes up for a cut expecting more room outside off. But this is the wrong'un so it spins into him to deny him that room and leaves him beaten as it misses off-stump
shortish, minimal room outside off, Williamson jabs at it with an angled bat and ekes out an inside edge towards fine leg
short of good length, just outside off, gets on top of the bounce and punches into the off side
full and angling in on middle and leg, pushed along the ground to long-on
short ball, doesn't quite latch on to a pull to the right of midwicket who makes an unsatisfactory effort to Sarfraz

dropped. Sarfraz with a decent effort but can't latch on.Williamson sticks the bat outside off to one that straightens down the fifth-stump channel. Sticks the right glove out and leaps across but it doesn't stick on. It wasn't as wide from him as the dive made it seem. Got to take those
loops up a full toss around off that is driven out to the covers
fullish length on middle and leg, pushed down the ground for one
full toss around off, driven to mid-off
non-turning fullish length ball around off, good pace at 93.3 ks, defended
leans into a drive to cover and point
full, pushed into the covers for one
fullish length outside off, driven into the covers
short of a length outside off, gets on top of it and runs it down through backward point for a single
advances to this fuller incoming delivery and just helps it with the angle straight down the ground. Struck crisply over mid-on
length ball on off, nudged into square leg for one
back of a length, nips away slightly, Guptill plays away from the body as he drops it into the off side
trickles this one away fine. Too full and coming into his pads, Guptill helps it on its way behind square, through the fine leg region. Fifty of the partnership
loops up a slider on leg stump, clipped through square leg
full and tight on middle and leg, comes forward and pushes it back
flat length ball on the stumps, punched down the ground
advances down the ground to meet the pitch and waits to see if he has got it past mid-off with this push before going ahead with the single
full around off, pushed towards mid-off
Guptill dares to go against the turn and closes the face of his bat. Pops up a leading edge but it lands safely on the off side
vintage Guptill. He has a liking for finding the roofs of stadiums. And it helps when you pitch it up within his swinging arc like that. Shovelled over long-on
tries to turn it behind square leg but gets hit on the pad as the ball drifts into him sharply
defended down the pitch
comes down the track and carves out a drive but can't beat a diving extra cover
advances to meet this low full toss and pushes it down to long-on
too short. Can't be bowling like that with this sort of bounce on offer. And it helps that it's a googly as Guptill pulls it with the turn over midwicket
this one's even bigger. Another rank long-hop, pitches midway and Williamson rocks back before carting a pull with the wind over deep midwicket
shortish and bit of width, cut through the covers

oh, dear! What a tame dismissal! He had no business getting out to that one. It was a nothing wide delivery and shortish as well. Guptill flashes outside off but simply hits it straight into the hands of backward point. This partnership was swelling and beginning to look dangerous. Timely strike for Pakistan
advances down the ground and pushes this down the ground
length ball, spins away towards off, Williamson defends neatly off the front foot
stays in the crease to this length ball on the middle and leg channel and wristily whips it out to midwicket
short and spinning away, stabbed to point
short of good length, not as much turn this time but still enough room for a cut to sweeper cover
skips down the track but he drags the length back as Taylor gets nowhere close to the pitch an awkwardly fends it away into the off side
full on middle, defended back
short and a little bit of spin outside off, shifts back and punches down the ground to long-off
fuller outside off, driven down to long-off
advances down the ground and whips it wide of long-on
pushes a fuller delivery down to wide long-on, and that brings up another fifty for Williamson
short and wide, cut to the covers
slightly back of a length, stays back and punches down to long-on
fullish outside off, driven to the left of the bowler who dives and stops
loops up a fuller one outside off that's been whipped to deep midwicket and they apply pressure on the fielder to come back for the second
short of good length, jumps back and keeps it out into the pitch
short ball, Williamson pulls imperiously through backward square leg
short of good length around off, jumps up and defends
short of a length and slanted across a set of stump outside off, Williamson sticks the bat out and gently eases it through cover who can't make a clean stop
drills a fullish length ball hard into the off side
short of good length, gets an inside edge onto the boot as he stands in the crease and defends
short of a length on off, turns it away to midwicket
fullish around off, pushed back
full and angling in on middle and off, clipped out to deep midwicket
short of a length, chops as he flashes a cut square of conventional third man
short ball, pulls powerfully to square leg where the fielder in the deep dives late as the ball drifts away from him. Good stop
full on middle and off, angling into him, pushed towards mid-on for a very quick one
shortish and a little bit of width outside off, flashes and gets a single down to third man
full, well outside off, driven crisply straight to the cover

flashes extremely hard well outside off. He can afford to do it with nobody in the slip cordon. This one holds its like but it's so wide and he gets a healthy outside edge that races down to third man
short ball, outside off, comfortably gets on top of the bounce and crunches a pull through midwicket
short of a length outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man for a single

edged and falls short. The slip fielder had just come in a couple of deliveries back. Taylor this time pushes away from the body, but got to wonder if the fielder was standing a bit too back. The edge falls just short of him as he tumbles to his right
full outside off and driven on the up, can't find the gap, and is stopped by the man at cover
back of a length outside off, chops it down to third man off the back foot

sharp nip off the surface! Good length outside off but angling into the right hander, moves sharply into Taylor's body and he's beaten for pace. Off stump is dislodged and Taylor has to make his way back
good length on middle stump, taps this back to the bowler
full on middle and that's crisply driven to mid off, well intercepted by the fielder, which forces the batsman to settle for the dot
good length on middle stump, tapped off the back foot to cover
back of a length outside off, stays tall and cuts off the back foot past point. There's the man in the deep
good length on middle and leg, punched off the back foot with the angled bat, straight to point
full on off stump, driven down the ground to mid on. They want the single, and this time Latham gets off the mark
good length outside off, carves this behind square off the back foot, third man has to give it a chase but a diving stop ensures the ball doesn't go for four
short ball on off stump, too short actually as the ball flies over Latham's head despite him not ducking. They consider taking a bye, but don't
soft! Lobbed to midwicket for the simplest of catches. The extra ball gets the wicket. Good length on middle stump and Latham tried to work this towards the leg side, leading edge taken by Babar
back of a length outside off, cut off the back foot to deep point
yorker on off stump, first ball-yorker dealt well by Nicholls
good length on middle stump, tries to flick towards the leg side but the leading edge has taken the ball to third man
full on off stump, tries to drive but inside edge goes through to fine leg
full on off stump, driven to mid on. Loud 'no' from the non-striker
full and wide outside off, firmly cut off the back foot. Beats point, but can't beat the man at wide third man
good length on the fourth-stump line, punched off the back foot to cover. No chance of a run
short on off stump and it's pulled along the carpet. Well hit, and deep midwicket has to dive to his left to stop the ball. Applause all around for the effort
good length outside off, punched off the back foot to mid off
good length on middle stump, turned off his hips past the man at short fine leg. He's racing behind it, but his valiant dive can't stop the ball either
back of a length outside off, driven off the back foot. Straight to cover
good length outside off, pokes at it, played towards point off the back foot
full on middle stump, down on one knee and paddled fine down the leg side, good work from the fielder at fine leg, pulling the ball back just in time
flat and wide outside off, cut along the ground to deep point
tossed up full on leg stump, driven back past the bowler's left. In the air, but falls safely in front of the mid-on area
full on middle and off, comes down the ground and checks his shot
back of a length on off stump, stays deep in his crease, punches this back to the bowler
flat and wide outside off once again, carved off the back foot past point
back of a length outside off, pushes at it with soft hands, the ball trickles away towards mid off as Nicholls takes off for the quick run
good length on off stump, KW walks across to the off side and taps this down the ground to mid on. Another loud and clear call for the quick single
good length on off stump, tapped off the back foot to point
back of  a length wide outside off, driven with the square bat past cover point, only a single
back of a length outside off, pushes at it with the angled bat. Runs it down to deep point
fuller, slower ball to end the over. Deceives the batsman with the lack of pace, defended back to the bowler
flat on middle stump, short ball too and it's pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, KW comes down the ground and smacks this past the bowler's left
back of a length on off stump and it's pulled with quite the muscle behind it. But cow corner is covered with the man, exactly for that very short
fuller ball on off stump, defended off the front foot by Williamson
back of a length on off stump, another attempted pull that did not come off. Known as Titanic of the 1800s.
full on leg stump, driven down the ground to long on!
short outside off but angling into KW, pulled to deep midwicket
well stopped by the bowler! Full on off stump and Nicholls smack this straight, Rumman sticks his hand out and stops it from going past him
back of a length outside off, late tail into the left-hander, cut to point but can't find the gap
short on off stump and pulled once again to the man at deep midwicket. Another single
full outside off, punched off the back foot to cover
dot ball to end the over, can't find the gap
back of a length outside off, spinning away form the right hander, tries to cut but can't connect. Mistimed back to the bowler
full ball on middle stump, big stride forward from Nicholls, before defending to cover
free runs! This won't please the captain. Short on leg stump but spinning down the leg side. Sarfraz couldn't grab onto it either
back of a length on middle stump, tapped off the back foot to mid on. They want the single, but Shadab is quick to stop the ball from going too far
full on off stump, and Nicholls brings out the reverse sweep! Well connected, and beats the man at short third man. Easily done
short on leg stump, down on one knee and pulled to deep midwicket
full and sliding on the pads, clipped to midwicket
slower full ball outside off, crunches a drive to sweeper cover
good length around off, again no pace at 123kmph, Williamson cautiously pushes it out towards long-on
dipping full toss on leg, turns it away to midwicket who makes a diving save
pulls this short delivery but the lack of pace messes up the timing as he gets an under-edge to backward square leg
length ball outside off, punched to deep point
good length, pitches outside leg and angles across on off, pushed down towards mid-off

walks across a long way and tries to ramp it up but the bowler has done very smartly to take it a long way away from him. And there is a bizarre wide call. That's very harsh. Williamson had walked across well past the off-stump. Almost a set of stumps, in fact. That's a poor call
fuller, leans into a push to mid-off
full outside off, tails in to find the inside of the bat as Williamson pushes to long-on

walks down the track to this shortish delivery but manages to adjust well as he pulls it from the leg-side line through midwicket. There is a fielder in the deep. He runs to his left but does not pick the trajectory well. The ball may have also drifted away from him a bit, making it worse. But a very poor effort nonetheless. Can't be missing those
short of good length, pulled behind square
back of a length, turns it into the midwicket region
short and wide, cut to the right of sweeper cover
in the air and doesn't carry. Backs away to a shortish ball that follows him and tucks him up for room. Tries to force a pull and gets a top-edge that lands well short of deep midwicket
short of a length, width on offer, opens the face to run it through backward point. They push back for the second and the bails are off at the keeper's end but Williamson is well inside
works this wide delivery through the backward point region. Hit a lot straighter to the fielder this time so they'll only get one
sprayed down the leg side

short ball, pulled to the left of deep midwicket, and hang on, there seems to have been a mid-pitch collision here. Ah, that is nasty. Nicholls was ball-watching as he set off for the run, as was Amir. By the time he turns around, it's too late to change direction. He thuds straight into the right shoulder of Amir who goes down immediately. Nicholls goes down momentarily as well but is the first to get up. All fine now
short of a length around off, punched through the covers

there's the hundred. Williamson completes a finely-crafted century. This was an absolutely classy innings. Gets the width he's looking for outside off and flashes through the point region for a boundary. Soaks in a rich applause from the Wellington faithful
turns this away to midwicket for one
advances down the ground and flashes at this wide delivery to beat point for a single
yorker on middle and leg, squeezed out to square leg

short ball, gets too big on him. What has that come off? Certainly didn't seem in control of that one. Very quick bouncer that almost causes him to take his eyes off. Off the top-edge to deep fine leg
short ball, cuts uppishly to sweeper cover
short ball, not in control of a pull to deep midwicket as it climbs onto him
full and heading towards leg, clipped behind square
short ball, tries to get on top of the bounce but doesn't. Swats it between mid-on and midwicket and it drops in no man's land
slower length ball outside off, 102.8 kmph, swings and misses
slower fullish delivery, slashes at it and works it to covers
yorker on off stump, squeezed fine down the leg side by getting his toes out of the way, played to fine leg
improvised! Premeditated shot, and it gets him full value. Walks across to the off side and ramps this full ball over the keeper's head. Paddled
full on middle stump, muscled down the ground to mid on. Tight single, but the direct hit doesnt come off
back of a length outside off, pulled to midwicket and the fielding stops the single, but the throw is poor, and no one is backing u, allowing them to take the run eventually
good length on middle stump, tapped into the deck, trickles away to point
good length on middle stump, backs away by walking towards the leg side, but punched straight to mid off
extremely full on off, pushed out past mid-off and they scamper back for the second

goes for a big heave and makes no good connection. This is a back-of-the-hand slower ball and Williamson as a result skews it off the bottom of the bat to be caught at extra cover where Hasan Ali snaffles it with the sun in his eyes
short ball, pretty high bounce but manages to get on top of it and swats a pull through midwicket
slower full ball, drilled through midwicket and square leg
dipping fuller ball on leg, clipped through midwicket. Fifty for Nicholls
short ball, pulled through midwicket who makes a scampering effort but just can't stop the ball cleanly enough and allows a second
gets around for a scoop but Hasan smartly follows him. Fires a low full toss around his off-stump and Nicholls skews it off the splice to the keeper. Can't get any distance on that whatsoever
looks for a glance fine but gets hit on the pad as the ball trickles down. This is now the highest total at the Basin reserve
wants a yorker and instead sprays a full toss on middle and leg that's heaved over deep midwicket
gets the back leg out to throw the bowler off guard and ends up staying put. Gets a fuller delivery  that is swatted down to long-on. And that's some brilliant running as well
tries to pull a delivery that'snot short enough and skews it off the bottom of the bat to midwicket
wide yorker, well-bowled. Southee jams the bat down and can't manage any contact
length ball, tries to swat it away and skews it off the toe end into the off side
full and angling into leg-stump. It's almost a yorker but Santnet brilliantly moves away and gets underneath before drilling it through the region between midwicket and mid-on
tries to pull a short ball but gets severely tucked up as the bowler's angle follows him and he gets a bottom edge to the keeper

Santner hits this pull in the direction of the breeze but he has holed out to cow corner. Gets on top of the bounce nicely and even makes pretty good connection. But probably not as well-middled we he would have liked. Smart take by Raees
brilliant. Top shot to end the innings. Walks across early enough, almost telegraphs it. Amit adjusts poorly. Fires it full and across him and Southee simply helps it on its way to fine leg
length ball on middle and leg, tucked into the midwicket region. No swing there
similar line, similar length, dabbed through midwicket for the first runs of the chase
poor delivery. Not getting the shape he's looking for. Full and on the pads, clipped away just behind square leg

looks mighty close and given. That looked plumb. Azhar contemplates on a review. He takes it but I highly doubt this will help Pakistan. This was full and straight. Just came on with the angle and Azhar looks to flick across the line. No inside edge, HotSpot confirms, as does Snicko. This will come down to ball-tracking. Hitting the top of leg, so on-field call remains. Pakistan lose their review
short, banged in down the leg side

another appeal and given. Azam falls for a two-ball duck, and there is no review available because Azhar used it up. FInally gets that shape into the batsman, but this one seems to be a harsh call. Kicks up from a back of a length and hits Babar above the knee roll. Height definitely makes this a dodgy call
offers a lot of width outside off and it holds its line, left alone
fullish and tailing away a long way outside off, left alone
length ball, angled in a lot closer to the off-stump and nips away, left alone
fullish and angling in on the pads, whipped away through square leg. First boundary of the chase
well-directed short ball, just outside off, arches back and sways out of the line
beauty! Invites him with a tempting length ball outside off and jags away late to beat the outside edge
short of a length, gets big on him and has him beaten as he tries to steer it away with an open bat face
short ball, a bit of movement outside off, left alone
length ball, holds its line outside off, left alone
short ball, gets on top of the bounce and pats it down in the direction of third man
length ball, pitches outside leg and angles across on off, turns it away to midwicket
fullish length outside off, bunts it into the covers
full on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
cuts in viciously from a short of a length and completely tucks up Hafeez as he inside-edges to the pad
is that an lbw? Inside edge may have saved him. Tries to flick and gets a bit of bat to it as it hits him in front. Boult doesn't bother appealing
fuller, pushed down the ground
another back of a length delivery that is inside-edged into the pad

in the air and taken. Loose shot from Hafeez. No control whatsoever. That's a terrible shot with a boundary rider at backward square leg. Hooks a short ball that gets big on him and Southee runs to his left to snaffle it
short of good length, straightens down the middle and leg channel, Malik helps it on its way to deep fine leg
good length outside off, defended
sprays a full toss with lots of width and Zaman drives with a full face of the bat through the covers
short of good length on off, gets on top of it and defends into the off side
short ball, angles away late, too high
full on leg stump, clipped out in front of mid-on
length outside off, defended
back of a length outside off, blocked from the crease
fullish length, swings away late, drops it towards mid-off and thinks of the single but decides against it
full and on the pads, clipped to midwicket
length ball, turned into midwicket
short of good length, tries to get on top of it and gets an inside edge
fuller ball, driven to mid-off
back of a length, outside off, arches out of the way
length ball outside off, defends towards point
shortish and a little wide, slashes a cut to square third man
full on off, defended back
fuller ball, rolls his wrists as he drills into the leg side
fullish and lots of width on that occasion, crashes a drive through extra cover
good length on off, defended
flashes at a length ball outside off and gets beaten
fuller delivery outside off, eases into a drive through point
full, driven to mid-on
short of good length outside off, gets on top of the bounce and punches it through the covers for another four. This is another good shot. Gets on top of the bounce and gets solidly behind the line
short ball, gets pushed back as he drops it into the pitch
fuller, outside off, drilled to midwicket
width on offer, tries to cut but it's not short enough and he gets beaten
fullish and holding its line outside off, left alone
edged and gone. Cross-seamer, angled in at fourth-stump channel and straightens, forces Malik to poke at it and finds the edge that's snaffled by the keeper
length ball, left alone as it holds its line outside off
fullish outside off, drilled to mid-on
length ball, pitches outside leg, punched into the on side
fuller delivery, flicked to deep midwicket
shortish, angling in on off, jumps back and defends
short of a length on off, defended
short ball, Zaman is pushed into a pull to deep backward square leg
short ball, climbs at serious pace. 153.4kmph. Sarfraz can't get anywhere near the top of that and flashes a half-angled bat to get beaten
worked to midwicket
short of a length, pitching on middle and leg and angling away, defended
short of a length, leaves the left-hander outside off, left alone
short of a length on off, punched to mid-off
short ball, pulled to deep square leg
pushes forward to a wide delivery and steers it uppishly through backward of point
shortish, angles in from outside off and cuts back in off the seam to beat the inside edge as Sarfraz loosely hangs the bat away from the body
again flashes outside off, this time looks for a cheeky dab down to third man but it's short and pacy and beats him. Shoots past the outside edge
short of a length around off, tentatively defends from the crease, into the surface
short, gets over the arched back of the batsman
length, wide outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, defended
pitched up down the leg side and misses the batsman's attempted flick
full and slanted across, pushed back
full on middle, loopy again, clipped to midwicket
looped up on middle and off, defended
short of a length, punched to the left of  the bowler
lots of flight and loop outside off, pushed back
full around off, eased down the pitch
another dart at 150.6 kmph, pushes it back down the pitch
shortish and a bit of width, rushed for pace - 147ks - and can't time his cut properly
drives a fuller ball to mid-off for a very quick single
tries to ramp up this short ball but against Ferguson's pace that's a mug's game. No contact
this time he manages to get on top of the bounce of this short of a length delivery and grinds it through backward point
extremely full on the stumps, dug out
slider down the leg side, tries to flick and makes no contact. Latham makes an amusingly optimistic appeal for caught-behind
fuller, driven off the front foot into the off side
stays back to this sliding length ball and punches back
full on off, pushed off the front foot to mid-off
hangs back to a length ball outside off and drops it to point with an open face
short and wide, spins away outside off and Sarfraz cuts late. Santner dives to his right but makes a complete mess of it.Made it look a lot harder than it was. Should have been stopped
short of a length on leg, punched off the backfoot

Sarfraz has been sent back. He stays put for just a moment and it makes you wonder if it's another dodgy. But tell you what. That doesn't seem so bad. Seems plumb. He brings the front foot forward to a loopy length ball that straightens down the middle and leg channel and pins him in front
full and sliding down leg, tries to clip it and the ball skips behind to fine leg off the pad
short of a length and some width, backs away and taps it to point
Williamson dives from mid-off and the ball falls short of him. Zaman skips down the track and chips an awkward inside-out drive
full and sliding on middle and leg, defended
presses forward to this length ball that comes on with the arm and finds the inside edge to midwicket
good length, straightens on leg, tucked through square leg
comes forward to this and there is some sharp turn as it takes the outside of the bat towards short third man
back of a length, some spin towards off, shifts back and defends into the leg side
full outside off, driven to the left of sweeper cover
short and spinning away, cuts through point
gets an outside edge as he shapes for a cut but the ball spins into him to tuck him up
defended to the left of the bowler
flicks this fuller ball to square leg
pushes back to this pacy length ball and defends hurriedly from front of leg
pitched up outside leg, trickles it away to short fine leg
floats up a fuller delivery and slants it across his off-stump and this has been launched over cow corner
advances down the ground again, it's again within his swinging arc and he has hammered this with the wind over cow corner. The last one seemed like a chance momentarily but this one's cleaner
fuller outside off, defended
advances down the ground and pushes this fuller ball out to deep midwicket
full and floated across, driven out
short of a length, comes on straight around off, taps it square of the wicket for one
length ball, spins in towards off, blocked
full and tight on middle and leg, defended off the front foot
dipping full toss on middle, flicked out along the ground to midwicket
gets down for a sweep and the ball drifts down leg to beat him
loopy and pitched up on leg, driven into the midwicket region
full on leg stump, comes forward and eases it down to long-on for a fifty
length ball on middle, defended
full on the stumps, drives uppishly through the covers. Well wide of extra cover
short of good length, straightens on middle, rocks back and heaves a pull over midwicket
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
full outside off, driven to the left of mid-off, where Williamson makes a good diving stop
length ball outside off, flat-batted to the right of mid-off
bouncer over off stump, Shadab leaves it alone and it's signalled wide for height
fullish outside off, driven to mid-off
back of a length outside off, tries to carve it through point and gets a thick edge down to third man
bouncer, gets up towards the right shoulder and hits him there as Fakhar misses the hook. Late on the shot
full-toss on leg stump - was it above waist height? Just below, I think. Squeezed away through midwicket
flat and fairly full on leg stump, swept to deep backward square leg
low full-toss outside off, reaches out and drives to long-off
nice length on off stump, driven to the left of short extra, and Guptill moves quickly to deny the single
beauty. Quick turn from a superb length just outside off stump, beats the outside edge as he presses forward to defend
short outside off. Stops on him slightly and he flat-bats back to the bowler. Wanted to slap it through the covers, I thought
fuller now, on off stump, defended into the covers
length ball on off stump. Stays leg-side of the ball and slaps to deep point
good ball, back of a length, angling into off stump at 145.6kph. Defended off the back foot, got nicely behind it
back of a length on middle stump, and that's very nicely played. Good use of the wrists to work it to the right of the diving square leg fielder. 145.8kph
hits the pitch hard again, 149kph. Back of a length just outside off. Looks to punch off the back foot but he's slightly late on it. Jabs it down into the pitch and it rolls towards slip
short now, into the body at 145kph. Jumps in the air and fends it away, awkwardly, towards square leg. Could have easily popped up - he took his eye off the ball there
short, angling across to off stump. Gets nicely on top of the bounce and steers it through point
floated up outside off, driven down the ground
non-turning length ball on middle and off, blocked off the front foot
length ball, punched down to long-on with the full face of his bat
sliding length ball, gets an inside edge to the leg side
short and wide, cut off the backfoot to point
uppish and over long-off. Advances down the ground, meets the pitch and swings clean. Well over the fielder leaping with his right hand outstretched
short of a length outside off, opens the face to run it down to third man
short and wide, flays a cut through point
length ball outside off, punched towards point
short ball, ramps it over backward point. On the bounce over the boundary
good length, cuts in to find the inside edge as he chops onto the pad
short of a length, drifting down the leg side. Latham flings himself to his left to save four byes
similar shot to the last boundary. Short and width on offer outside off, ramps it over point. A couple of bounces over the boundary
fuller delivery outside off, driven into the covers
short ball, mistimes a pull wide of midwicket
short ball, pulled uppishly, one-bounce to deep midwicket
fuller delivery outside off, crunches a hard drive through the cover and point region

finally they have broken the stand. A 78-run one. And it's the short ball that does it. Shadab takes it on and tries to pull. Considerable bounce on this delivery, and just enough to take the top-edge as Latham runs back from behind the stumps and pouches it

is that a drop?. Faheem Ashraf misjudges the pace on this fuller delivery and leans forward early to chip a drive. Mitchell Santner bends forward from mid-off and puts down a simple catch. That should have really been taken. Definitely carried
that's what pace can do for a batsman. Slashes an upper cut at the sight of width, and with the ball coming on at that clip, it's enough connection to carry it all the way over the boundary
doesn't get hold of a pull this time as he drags it down to long-on. Not much momentum as the ball bounces well in front of the rope and loses a lot of its momentum
full, outside off, driven towards mid-off
short of a length, tucked off the pads to deep fine leg
short of a length, tries to stay in the crease and run it down but the bounce is considerable and he gets beaten
length ball, pitches outside leg, pushes it to mid-off and takes off for a very quick single. Comfortably beats the throw from the fielder running in
short ball, laces a cut through point
full on the pads, clipped to midwicket
short of good length, sitting up nicely, Ashraf pulls it through midwicket. Allowing the new batsman to settle in

oh top shot. Overcompensates with the length. Wanted to york him actually and instead sends down a fuller delivery.  Not a very bad delivery but a super shot. Presents the full face and eases it down to long-on
shortish, pitching outside leg, pulled behind square
short ball, gets up too much and called a wide
short and wide outside off this time, the umpire deems it okay
looped up down the leg side
pushes across a length ball on off, defended
good length outside off, shuffles across and bunts it out down the pitch
slanted across outside off, Ashraf plays for the turn but it comes on with the angle to beat the outside edge
pitched up within his swinging arc and he has launched this high and long straight over
good length, flicked to midwicket
stays back to a length ball and drops it into the off side
short of good length on off, punched into the off side
